thread.title: This Model Mom Just Dropped Some Truth About How Pregnancy Changes Your Stomach
thread.title_full: This Model Mom Just Dropped Some Truth About How Pregnancy Changes Your Stomach

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: This Model Mom Just Dropped Some Truth About How Pregnancy Changes Your Stomach
text:
Australian model Tammy Hembrow delivered her second child six months ago. Her postpartum recovery was miraculously quick, even though she complained that her body "blew up like a balloon" right after giving birth and said she had to use a postpartum binder for a week following delivery due to diastasis recti, or abdominal separation.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Tammy at 36 Weeks Pregnant 9 months üôÜüèº Feeling exhausted puffy & swollen but BEYOND excited for our little princess to arrive üíû ‚ú® #36weeks #notlongnow #patientlywaiting
A post shared by Tammy ü¶Ñ (@tammyhembrow) on Jul 23, 2016 at 9:19pm PDT
Tammy 3 Weeks After Giving Birth When the @gymshark trackpants hug you just right. #3weekspostpartum #gymshark
A post shared by Tammy ü¶Ñ (@tammyhembrow) on Aug 25, 2016 at 11:22pm PDT
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Tammy 3 1/2 Months After Giving Birth Three & a half months postpartum - For my workouts I did while pregnant go to www.tammyhembrow.org üíï
A post shared by Tammy ü¶Ñ (@tammyhembrow) on Nov 17, 2016 at 9:08pm PST
While Tammy has written in captions that she's not 100 percent happy with her postpartum physique, since she lost so much muscle mass during the time she took off from the gym to recover from childbirth, she's not mad about the way pregnancy has left its mark on her stomach, according to a revealing Instagram photo she recently posted:
Proud of my mama bod & my loose skin ü§òüèΩüí™üèΩ - Wearing @gymshark #gymshark #6monthspostpartum
A post shared by Tammy ü¶Ñ (@tammyhembrow) on Feb 17, 2017 at 7:20pm PST
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below In the photo above, the positioning of Tammy's baby's foot makes the loose skin on her stomach look more pronounced than it might seem in her other photos. "Proud of my mama bod & my loose skin," she wrote in the caption.
While some of her followers chimed in with critique ("There is no loose skin there u don't know the definition of loose skin," one commented) others praised Tammy for her openness: "The fact that you don't hide yours and embrace [it] makes me stop being so ashamed [of my loose skin]," one wrote.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below More than 437,400 people liked the post, which just goes to show most of Tammy's fans think evidence of motherhood only makes her more perfect ‚Äî and the same goes for other new moms, regardless of how they look after pregnancy.
